result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan Roger Yeazle

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.

1:42 PM 
Defendant Nathan Roger Yeazle in court.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint.
Court verbally reviews charges/penalties for the record.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
Court informs the defendant of his right to counsel.
Defendant is provided with PD phone number and petition for court appointed counsel. 

Court Orders: $2,000.00 Signature Bond 
-No alcohol or controlled substance
